verses.roman:
anuvādam anuktvaiva
na vidheyam udīrayet
na hy alabdhāspadaṁ kiñcit
kutracit pratitiṣṭhati

synonyms: anuvādam—things already known; anuktvā—without mentioning; eva—certainly; na—not; vidheyam—unknown subject matters; udīrayet—one should mention; na—not; hi—certainly; alabdha-āspadam—without having achieved a proper place; kiñcit—something; kutracit—anywhere; pratitiṣṭhati—has a position.
translation: " 'Without first mentioning what is known, one should not introduce the unknown, for that which has no solid basis can never be established anywhere.'

purport.content: This is a verse from the Ekādaśī-tattva.
